ratings.comment: Terrible class.  It needs a pre req.  Take this class only if you have a vast knowledge of this area of history/religion.  He jumps into lectures with no background on the topic or the people, which makes it hard to figure out what is actually going on.  Lectures are poorly organized as a whole.  I walked away learning nothing.

Very fast paced, however, every single graded piece of work is take home.  there is really no excuse for poor grades that way. It's all directly from the notes in class or the readings.  All the material is there. Plus, he meets outside of class to talk about anything and everything.  Also, he goes over lectures early if you must be absent. Amazing

Tough class.  He really expects a lot and he throws it at you fast.  Only 4 assignments per se, however, they're a lot of work and the reading is nearly impossible to keep up with.  However, this guy knows and loves his field more than anyone I've met.  If you're not affraid to work, have the best time of your life in this class

Very smart and, if you can keep up, the lectures are interesting. Throws a lot of information out at once so note-taking is very hard. He assigns a lot of reading & you'll be copying a lot out of the reserves section. But very friendly and a pretty dry sense of humor. Also this class is hard if you don't have a background. Overall, a good prof. :)
Very intersting, probably the most brilliant mind in his field...a little dry, and a lot of work.
